definition: essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)
to open (a door)/to open up (for development)/to dispel/to refute/to repudiate

sentences.english: Can you sum up your mother in just six words?
sentences.chinese: 你能只用六个单词就精辟地形容你的母亲吗？

sentences.english: Her article brilliantly demolishes his argument.
sentences.chinese: 她的文章精辟地批驳了他的论点。

sentences.english: The book is well written, properly illustrated and excellently captioned.
sentences.chinese: 这本书写得很好，插图生动形象，说明文字简练精辟。

sentences.english: Qian Mu has a lot of rich and brilliant expositions on methodology of history study.
sentences.chinese: 钱穆对史学方法论有相当丰富和精辟的论述。

sentences.english: Herr article brilliantly demolishes his argument.
sentences.chinese: 她的文章精辟地批驳了他的论点。

sentences.english: Colton, a great writer once remarked. But it still has a profound significance now.
sentences.chinese: 他的这个精辟的论断至今仍有深远的意义。

sentences.english: "Thereis no such thing as a free lunch" is as good a slogan as any I know.
sentences.chinese: “天下没有免费的午餐”，这是一条精辟的谚语。

sentences.english: Yellow Emperor is the best one who can spell out Tao.
sentences.chinese: 黄帝真是天底下，最能将道理说得精辟透彻的人了。

sentences.english: Once you have drilled into a topic, you’re primed for some serious insight.
sentences.chinese: 当您反复钻研某一主题时，您就具备了一些精辟见解。

definition: lit. to draw blood on the first prick (idiom)/fig. to hit the nail on the head
to hit the mark with a comment (idiom)/to say sth spot on
to hit the target and do real damage (idiom)/fig. to hit where it hurts/fig. to hit home/an argument that hits the nail on the head
see 一語中的|一语中的[yi1 yu3 zhong4 di4]
